Package metro.algorithm

Class SimulationModel

java.lang.Object
metro.algorithm.SimulationModel
public class SimulationModel
extends java.lang.Object
A class defining an app simulating the concurrently working metro Use start() method to launch the GUI of the simulation.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    SimulationModel​(FieldTypes[] trainOrder)
    Initializes routes to the default values.
    SimulationModel​(FieldTypes[] trainOrder, Coordinates[][] routes)
    Initializes routes to the default values.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void end()
    Ends the simulation by interrupting its thread.
    TunnelsMapMonitor getMonitor()
    Returns the monitor attached to this model.
    int getNumberOfTrains()
    Returns number of trains in the simulation.
    Coordinates[] getRouteEnds()  
    Coordinates[] getRouteStarts()  
    void pause()
    Pauses the execution after the current train arrives at the station
    void restart()
    Restarts the simulation

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • SimulationModel

      public SimulationModel​(FieldTypes[] trainOrder)
      Initializes routes to the default values.
      Parameters:
      trainOrder - an array of FieldTypes enum values T1, T2, T3, specifying the initial order of the trains

    • SimulationModel

      public SimulationModel​(FieldTypes[] trainOrder, Coordinates[][] routes)
      Initializes routes to the default values.
      Parameters:
      trainOrder - an array of FieldTypes enum values T1, T2, T3, specifying the initial order of the trains
      routes - an array of Coordinates pairs, specifying each route's start and end e.g. For train 1 route routes[0][0] = start, route[0][1] = end For train 2 route routes[1][0] = start, route[1][1] = end

  • Method Details

    • end

      public void end()
      Ends the simulation by interrupting its thread.

    • pause

      public void pause()
      Pauses the execution after the current train arrives at the station

    • restart

      public void restart()
      Restarts the simulation

    • getMonitor

      public TunnelsMapMonitor getMonitor()
      Returns the monitor attached to this model.
      Returns:
      Monitor of the tunnel's map.

    • getNumberOfTrains

      public int getNumberOfTrains()
      Returns number of trains in the simulation.
      Returns:
      constant value specifying the number of trains in the simulation
